--- title: "4.1 — Modeling Firms With Market Power — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Date *Monday, April 24, 2023* ::: ::: callout-warning # Upcoming Assignment [Problem Set 5](/assignments/05-problem-set) (on classes 3.1-3.5) is due by 11:59 PM Wednesday April 26 on Blackboard Assignments. ::: ## Overview Today we begin our look at “imperfect competition,” where firms have market power, meaning they can charge $p>MC$ and search for the profit-maximizing quantity *and* price. Today is merely about how do change the model to understand how a firm with market power behaves. To assist us, we begin with an extreme case of a single seller, i.e. a **monopoly.** For now we only *assume* that there is a single firm, and see how it behaves differently than if it were in a competitive market. Next class we will begin to explore what could *cause* a market to have only a single seller, and what are some of the social consequences of market power. ## Readings - Ch. 9-2-9.5 in Goolsbee, Levitt, and Syverson, 2019 ## Practice Today we will be working on [practice problems](/practice/4.1-practice). Answers will be posted later on that page. ## Appendix See the online appendix for today's content: - [Monopolists Only Produce Where Demand is Elastic: Proof](/resources/appendices/4.1-appendix.html#monopolists-only-produce-where-demand-is-elastic-proof) - [Derivation of the Lerner Index](/resources/appendices/4.1-appendix.html#derivation-of-the-lerner-index) - [Firms With Market Power vs. Competitive Firms’ Responses to Market Changes](/resources/appendices/4.1-appendix.html#firms-with-market-power-vs.-competitive-firms-responses-to-market-changes) ## Assignments ### Problem Set 5 Due Wednesday April 26 [Problem Set 5](/assignments/05-problem-set) (on classes 3.1-3.5) is due by 11:59 PM Wednesday April 26 on Blackboard Assignments. ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats.
